title: The Art of Rome
quote: The Roman theater survives virtually intact... scarcely another surviving theater gives a better impression of just how the Roman theater - a solid single unified structure - differed from the Greek theater, which was made up of separate structures juxtaposed but each isolated and complete in itself.

title: Phoenician and Luwian in Early Iron Age Cilicia
author: Ilya Yakubovich

title: Le dialecte grec de Pamphylie: documents et grammaire
author: C. Brixhe

title: Understanding Architecture: Its Elements, History and Meaning
